newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH STATE NET BORROWING UP FIM 6.9 BLN IN AUG.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH STATE NET BORROWING UP FIM 6.9 BLN IN AUG.

text.p: Finnish state net borrowing increased by 6.9 billion markka in August to a January-August total of 41.3 billion, the State Treasury Office said on Wednesday.
Gross borrowing increased by 20 billion markka to 119.8 billion by end-August, it said.
The finance ministry has said this year's total net borrowing need will be about 44.7 billion markka.
At end-August, state debt was 407.5 billion markka, up 4.7 billion compared with end-July, STO said. Of the debt, 172.3 billion markka, or 42 percent, was in foreign currencies.
